Arp spoofing attacks utilize the ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) to conduct man in the middle attacks upon targets inside of a network.

Google's controversial decision to offer public access to .zip and .mov domains has opened the door to a new cybersecurity threat. Exploiting the familiarity of these file extensions cybercriminals can create deceptive URLs leading unsuspecting users to malicious websites.
